de.lmu.ifi.nm.www

Class Subtool

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.ifi.nm.www.Subtool

  • public class Subtool
extends java.lang.Object
    API to deal with classful subnetting.
    Since:
    1.2
    Author:
    Lance Colton, Andrew Madden

      void setMaskedBits(int maskedBits)
      Sets the total masked bits, which figures out the subnet bits, calls setSubnetBits() which figures out the subnet mask and calculates the rest of the data.

      • setSubnetMask

        public void setSubnetMask(java.lang.String ip)
        Sets the subnet mask, which in turn calculates everything else.
        Parameters:
        ip - the subnet mask
        Since:
        1.0

      • calculateBitInformation

        public void calculateBitInformation(java.lang.String sub_mask,
                           char network_class)
        Takes the subnet mask, and calculates the bit information. Sets the bit variables so they can be accessed.
        Parameters:
        sub_mask - the sub_mask
        network_class - the classful type of IP, a, b, c, or even d
        Since:
        1.0

      • setSubnetBits

        public void setSubnetBits(int subnetBits)
        Sets the subnet bits, which then resolves the subnet mask and calculates all of the other information.
        Parameters:
        subnetBits - the subnet bits
        Since:
        1.0

      • setIPAddress

        public void setIPAddress(java.lang.String ip)

        Parameters:
        ip - the new IP address
        Since:
        1.0

      • setTotalSubnets

        public void setTotalSubnets(int totalSubnets)
        Sets the total subnets required, which based on this calculates the subnet mask and figures out all of the other information.
        Parameters:
        totalSubnets - the total required subnets
        Since:
        1.0

      • setTotalHosts

        public void setTotalHosts(int totalHosts)
        Sets the total required hosts, which based on this calculates the subnet mask and figures out all of the other information.
        Parameters:
        totalHosts - the total required hosts
        Since:
        1.0

      • setMaskedBits

        public void setMaskedBits(int maskedBits)
        Sets the total masked bits, which figures out the subnet bits, calls setSubnetBits() which figures out the subnet mask and calculates the rest of the data.
        Parameters:
        maskedBits - the new masked bits
        Since:
        1.0
